pr_title: Make all the obj parameters in Field @NonNull.

timeline.message: Make all the obj parameters in Field @NonNull.

timeline.bodyText: Please also remove the @UnknownInitialization. We also don't want the top initialization qualifier, for the same reasons as why we don't want @Nullable.
timeline.author: wmdietl

replies.bodyText: Could you explain this comment?  We don't want @Nullable because it might lead to NullPointerException.  How does an @UnknownInitialization argument lead to an exception?
replies.author: mernst

replies.bodyText:
It won't lead to an exception, that is true. But it would allow reading information from an object that is still being initialized.
So then the return type should also be @UnknownInitialization, shouldn't it?
It seems easier to normally only allow fully initialized objects and require a suppression if the receiver is not.
replies.author: wmdietl

replies.bodyText: A @PolyInitialized annotation seems appropriate in that case.
replies.author: mernst

replies.bodyText: ... but until we do so, we could remove @UnknownInitialization.
replies.author: mernst

replies.bodyText:
Even if we had a @PolyInitialized, I think it would be unsound here.
Any field read from a fully-initialized object needs to be fully-initialized, but a field read from an under-initialization object may not be under initialization. So using @PolyInitialized would introduce an unsoundness.
replies.author: wmdietl

timeline.bodyText:
Related to the previous comment: allowing the value to be @Nullable, but not @UnknownInitialization, seems inconsistent.
I would change this to fully-initialized and non-null values only.
Otherwise, reflection can be used to set a field that is declared @NonNull to null, without a single warning that needs to be suppressed.
timeline.author: wmdietl

replies.bodyText: @mernst Do you agree with removing the @Nullable here?
replies.author: wmdietl

replies.bodyText: Yes, that seems reasonable.  Thanks for the comment.
replies.author: mernst

timeline.message: Remove @UnknownInitialization from all the get methods.
Merge branch 'jdk-update' of github.com:xingweitian/checker-framework into jdk-update
Reflect the changes in jdk11 to jdk8.
